chargeHist.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jovanni Marquez Vazquez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jovanni Marquez Vazquez not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Jovanni Marquez Vazquez.  
Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request a plea and sentencing date. 
Defense advised to file the plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing,. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

Court MODIFIED No Contact to Reflect: 
Defendant to have no contact with: CK, DLK, ZLK, ZYK ADN ZGK.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision LEVEL 5 and All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Jovanni Marquez Vazquez in court, in custody.  
Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Jovanni Marquez Vazquez.  
Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Mother ( NV) appears via zoom.
Victim ( CK) appears via zoom.

Case in court on defense motion to modify bail
Bail bond hearing proceeded.   Arguments heard by defense and the State. 
Court GRANTED defense bail motion for reasons placed on the record
Defense request a scheduling date. Defense need additional time to review all the discovery and negotiate with the State.
Court ordered matter adjourned for a Scheduling Conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Signed and filed, Defendant to have no contact with CNK.

Defendant Jovanni Marquez Vazquez in court, in custody.  
Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Jovanni Marquez Vazquez.  
Attorney Erika Strebel for  Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin.
Victim ( CK) with Victim/Witness Coordinator.

Case in court on defense motion to modify bail. 
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Bail bond hearing proceeded.   
Arguments heard by defense and the State. Statement made by victim.  
Court reserve ruling and requested defense counsel to provide additional information for the court to consider.
Defendant's Mother and Victim in this case can appear by zoom at the next hearing. 
Case remains calendared in Branch 19. Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jovanni Marquez Vazquez in court, in custody.  Attorney Connor Romenesko appeared by video for Jovanni Marquez Vazquez. Appy Rockendorf appeared in person for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took Judicial Notice to case 22CF28321 & 22CF2980.  Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Sgt. E. Tyrpak.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19. Defense wants to be heard on bail
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No driving without a valid license and insurance.

Defendant Jovanni Marquez Vazquez in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Jovanni Marquez Vazquez in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
